channel.title: Thread-4?
channel.description:
Does anyone know why my client would give me,
[code]Exception in thread "Thread-4" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space at Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.<init>(Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:105) at client.method6(client.java:7079) at Applet_Sub1.run(Applet_Sub1.java:51) at client.run(client.java:4506) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)[/code]
Last thing I did was edited some images with Tom's Cache Suite, this happens when it's 'Unpacking Media'.

item.title: Thread-4?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

It means that the JVM has run out of all the memory that has been allocated to it. You can change the amount of memory allocated for use by your JVM using the -Xms and -Xmx command line parameters.

For example, the following says run MyApp in a JVM and allocate a minimum of 5 Megabytes and a maximum of 15 Megabytes off of the heap in order to do so.

java -Xms5m -Xmx15m MyApp

Read full topic
